member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.BadWordEventArgs.BadWordList
member.summary: Gets a that contains all errors detected in the text.
member.remarks: The property contains the specific error being handled. You can use the collection to determine the total number of errors and the index of this error within the collection.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.BadWordEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this bad word should be ignored by the .

remarks.para: If the property is not null, then the error is about to be displayed in a spell dialog. Setting the Cancel parameter to true in this case causes the dialog to skip to the next error.

If the property is null, then the error was detected in as-you-type mode and the word is about to be underlined. Setting the Cancel parameter to true in this case prevents the word from being underlined.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.ISpellCheckableEditor
member.summary: Interface used to provide modal (dialog-based) spell-checking using a .

remarks.para: The can provide spell-checking for classes derived from the class ( and ).
To use with other editors, you should create a class that implements the interface on behalf of the editor.

member.summary: Selects a range of text in the editor.
member.param: Index of the character where the selection starts.
Length of the selection.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.ISpellCheckableEditor.HasMoreText
member.summary: Gets the next batch of text to spell check using the same modal dialog.
member.returns: True if there is more text to check, false otherwise.

remarks.para: This method allows spell-checking complex controls such as lists and grids. In these cases, a typical implementation will use this method to increment an internal index, update its property, and return true to continue spell-checking without closing the dialog.
Implementations for simple controls such as text boxes should simply return false.

member.summary: Called when the spell-checking process ends.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker
member.summary: Component that provides spell-checking services to controls and applications.

remarks.para: The C1SpelChecker component supports three spell-checking modes:
Use the , , and methods to check strings and get lists of errors and spelling suggestions.

Use the method to check the content of any -derived controls using a modal dialog. The C1SpellChecker will check the text and display a dialog where the user can choose to correct or ignore each error.
You can also check editors that do not derive from . To do that, you have to create a wrapper class that implements the interface.

Set the extender property SpellCheck on any -derived control to true, and the C1SpellChecker will monitor changes to the control. Any spelling mistakes will be indicated on the control by a red, wavy underline; right-clicking the errors will show a context menu with spelling suggestions.
You can also provide as-you-type spelling support for editors that do not derive from . To do that, you have to create a wrapper class that implements the interface.

In all three modes described above, the spell-checker follows rules that can be customized using the property. Options available include types of words to ignore (capitalization, numbers, URLs), whether to display suggestions in a context menu, the number of suggestions to display, and so on.
The C1SpellChecker component uses spelling dictionaries stored in files with a 'dct' extension.
To select which dictionary to use, use the property and set to the name of the file you want to use.

The easiest way to ensure the dictionary is deployed correctly is to add to your projects a reference to the dictionary file(s) you want to use, then set the Build Action property to None and the Copy to Output Directory property to Copy if newer. This way, the dictionaries will be copied to the output directory along with the application executable and the C1SpellChecker assembly.

When using this deployment method, make sure the main dictionary's value specifies a file name without a path. This way, the component will search for the dictionary in the directory where the C1SpellChecker assembly is located.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.Enabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the main spelling dictionary has been loaded.

remarks.para: If cannot find the spelling dictionary, it will not throw any exceptions. The Enabled property will be set to false and the component will not be able to spell-check any text.
You can check the state of the and the by inspecting their property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.Options
member.summary: Gets a object that specifies spell-checking options.
member.remarks: Options available include types of words to ignore, whether to display suggestions in a context menu, the number of suggestions to display, and so on.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.MainDictionary
member.summary: Gets the main dictionary used for spell-checking.

remarks.para: This is the main dictionary. It is stored in a compressed format, and is read-only.

You can edit the spell dictionaries or create your own using the C1DictionaryEditor utility that ships with . This option can be useful for domain-specific applications that require the use of technical jargon (for example, medical, legal, and so on).
Users cannot add words to this dictionary, only to the .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.UserDictionary
member.summary: Gets the user dictionary used for spell-checking.
member.remarks: This is the user dictionary. The user may add words to this dictionary using the spell-checking dialog, and it is automatically persisted to the specified file.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.CustomDictionary
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom spell-checking dictionary.
member.remarks: This property allows you to specify additional custom dictionaries to be used in addition to the standard and dictionaries.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.CustomParser
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom spell-checking parser.

remarks.para: This property allows you to specify a custom parser for breaking up text into words to be spell-checked.
For example, you may want to use a custom parser when checking source code files. This way you can spell-check the comments in the code and skip the actual code.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreList
member.summary: Gets the list of words to ignore during spell-checking.

remarks.para: The list is used by the built-in spell dialog and by the as-you-type mechanism.
The user may add words to this list using the "Ignore All" button in the spell dialog or the "Ignore All" option in the as-you-type context menu.
Strings in the list are case-sensitive.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.AutoReplaceList
member.summary: Gets a list of words and replacements to use while spell-checking.

remarks.para: This list is used by the built-in spell dialog and by the as-you-type mechanism.
The built-in spell dialog checks the list when it finds a misspelled word. If a match is found, the misspelled word is replaced with the corresponding list entry.
The as-you-type mechanism looks for matches whenever the user types a character that is not a letter or a digit. If a match is found, the text is replaced with the corresponding list entry.

Note the difference in operation between the two modes. In as-you-type spell-checking, any matches will be replaced, whether the key is spelled correctly or not. In dialog mode, keys that are spelled correctly will not be flagged as errors and therefore will not be replaced. For example, if the AutoReplaceList contains an entry with the strings ("attn.", "attention of"), then typing "attn. " into the editor will trigger a replacement and the editor will contain "attention of ". However, because "attn." is not a spelling error, the spell dialog will not replace instances of the string "attn." with "attention of".
The raises the event before making each automatic replacement. The event handler may cancel the replacement.
Strings in the list are case-sensitive.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.MaxWordLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of words that are spell-checked.

remarks.para: This property determines the maximum length of strings that are considered to be words and should be spell-checked. This enables the to automatically ignore long strings that contain non-textual information.
Setting this property to a value smaller than one causes all strings to be considered as words.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.BadWordFound
member.summary: Occurs when a spelling error is found by the .

remarks.para: This event occurs when the component detects a spelling error in a control. This happens while a spell dialog is displayed (see the method) or while the component is painting the red wavy underlines that mark misspelled words in dynamic mode (see the method).
The event parameters have a Dialog property that allow the handler to determine whether a spell dialog is being displayed or not.
The event parameters also have a Cancel property that can be used to ignore the error.

Note that this event occurs every time a misspelled word is about to be underlined, which occurs whenever the control is painted (not just when the bad word is initially typed into the control. Because of this, one single misspelled word can cause this event to fire multiple times.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.AutoReplace
member.summary: Occurs before the makes an automatic replacement in the control's text.
member.remarks: automatically replaces text as the user types based on the list of words specified by the property.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.ContextMenuCreated
member.summary: Occurs when a context menu is created containing the spelling suggestions and commands.

remarks.para: The spelling context menu is localized automatically based on the setting of the property. This event provides an easy way to perform additional customization of the menu should that be necessary.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.DictionaryChanged
member.summary: Occurs when any of the spell dictionaries changes in any way.
member.remarks: This event notifies listeners that the spell dictionaries have changed and the text should be re-checked. It occurs for example when words are added to the user dictionary or when new dictionaries are loaded.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.C1SpellChecker.ShowSuggestions
member.summary: Occurs when suggestions is about to show in the spell dialog or in the spell context menu.

remarks.para: Use this method to customize the suggestion list. Suggestions can be added, removed or rearranged.
If the suggestion list contains more items than , then the additional items won't be shown in the spell context menu.
This event does not occur when user calls method.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellDictionary
member.summary: Class that contains a list of words and methods looking them up and loading them from a compressed file.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellDictionary.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the dictionary contains a given word.
member.param: Word to lookup.
member.returns: True if the dictionary contains the word, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellDictionary.Load
member.summary: Loads the dictionary from the file specified by the property.
member.returns: True if the dictionary was loaded successfully, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If the dictionary fails to load, this method returns false. In this case, you can check the value of the dictionary's property to determine why the file failed to load.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellDictionary.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file that contains the dictionary.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellDictionary.Password
member.summary: Sets the password needed to load password-protected dictionaries.

remarks.para: If the dictionary file in use is password-protected, you must provide a valid password in order to use it.
The dictionary files that ship with are not password-protected. You can create password-protected dictionaries using the dictionary utility shipped with .

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellDictionary.WordCount
member.summary: Gets the number of words loaded in the dictionary.

member.summary: Method that retrieves the next word to spell-check in a string.
member.param: String that contains the text being spell-checked.
Position being checked within the string.
that specifies types of words that should be ignored.
Last word retrieved by the parser (used to detect duplicates).
member.returns: A object that represents the next word to be spell-checked, or null if all the text has been spell-checked.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.ISpellParser.FilterWord(System.String)
member.summary: Method that filters any unwanted characters out of a string to be checked.
member.param: Raw text to be checked.
member.returns: A modified word to be checked, null to skip checking this string, or the same word if no filtering is required.

remarks.para: This method is useful in custom parsers that should ignore specific characters or words.
For example, a parser that parses strings with accelerator characters should filter out the ampersands before the word is checked.

that will be expanded.

This method is used to extend editor selections before deleting duplicate words.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.None
member.summary: Do not ignore any words.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.Numbers
member.summary: Ignore words that contain numbers (digits).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.UpperCase
member.summary: Ignore words that are all uppercase.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.MixedCase
member.summary: Ignore words that contain a mix of uppercase and lowercase characters, except when there is a single uppercase at the start (for example, "Lowercase" would not be ignored, but "LowerCase" and "lowerCase" would).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.Urls
member.summary: Ignore words that look like URLs or file names.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.HtmlTags
member.summary: Ignore text in HTML/XML tags.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.Default
member.summary: Default setting: ignores numbers, mixed case, URLs, and HTML tags.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.IgnoreOptions.All
member.summary: Ignores numbers, mixed case, URLs, HTML tags, and uppercase.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of spelling suggestions to show in the editor's context menu.
member.remarks: The spelling context menu is displayed only if the property is set to true.

member.summary: Gets or sets types of words to ignore during the spell-check.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellOptions.ActiveSpellingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether active (as-you-type) spell-checking is enabled.

remarks.para: This property allows you to temporarily turn off active spell-checking for all connected editors.
To turn active spell-checking on or off for specific editors, use the method.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellOptions.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the wavy underlines drawn under misspelled words.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1SpellChecker.SpellOptions.DialogLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the used when displaying the built-in spell dialog.

remarks.para: The dialog language does not affect spelling. To change the language used for spelling, use the property to select a different spelling dictionary.

By default, the built-in spell dialog () is displayed in the language specified by the current culture. If the current culture specifies a language that is not available, then the dialog will be displayed in English.
See the enumeration for a list of supported dialog languages.
